LanguageData.ABF_NewbootSynstructCreatedText:
The final touches on a new {0} are complete. In order to begin contributing to the colony, you must format the synstruct as either a drone, a reprogrammable drone, or a sapient. Some races may only choose from one option, while others may choose from all three.

Drone features (Format as drone surgical operation):
- Does not learn, has preset skills.
- Has no mood or ideology, does not receive social engagement, and has limited needs.
- Counts as a fourth of a pawn for storyteller limits.

Reprogrammable drone features (Format as reprogrammable drone surgical operation):
- Does not learn, has minimal skills but can be configured to enable work types and increase skills.
- Uses complexity mechanics that limit how many work types, skills, or directives may be active at the same time.
- Allows for directives to be implemented, enhancing capability in select niches and fields.
- Has no mood or ideology, does not receive social engagement, and has limited needs.
- Counts as a fourth of a pawn for storyteller limits.

Sapient features (Format as sapient surgical operation):
- Fully self-aware and autonomous individuals, capable of learning.
- Are socially active and capable of entering friendships, rivalries, and relationships.
- Has moods, thoughts, ideology, and a full set of needs.
